sen.j: 徳大寺 実則（とくだいじ さねつね、天保10年12月6日 (旧暦)（1840年1月10日） - 1919年（大正8年）6月4日）は、幕末から明治期の公卿・官僚。
sen.e: Sanetsune TOKUDAIJI (January 10, 1840 to June 4, 1919) was a Kugyo (court noble) and bureaucrat from the late shogunate period to Meiji era.
Sanetsune TOKUDAIJI (January 10, 1840-June 4, 1919) was Kugyo (a court noble) and a bureaucrat from the late Edo period to the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: toをハイフンに変更、冠詞の位置変更、「幕末から明治期」の表現変更しました。
sen.e: Sanetsune TOKUDAIJI (January 10, 1840-June 4, 1919) was Kugyo (a court noble) and a bureaucrat from the late Edo period to the Meiji period.

sen.j: 父は徳大寺公純（とくだいじ きんいと）。
sen.e: His father was Kinito TOKUDAIJI.
His father was Kinito TOKUDAIJI.
His father was Kinito TOKUDAIJI.

sen.j: 弟に西園寺公望、住友友純、末弘威麿がいる。
sen.e: Among his younger brothers were Kinmochi SAIONJI, Tomoito SUMITOMO and Takemaro SUEHIRO.
Among his younger brothers were Kinmochi SAIONJI, Tomoito SUMITOMO and Takemaro SUEHIRO.
Among his younger brothers were Kinmochi SAIONJI, Tomoito SUMITOMO and Takemaro SUEHIRO.

sen.j: 尊皇攘夷派の公卿として活躍し、1862年（文久2年）国事御用掛、翌年議奏となった。
sen.e: He took an active part as a court noble of the Sonno-joi-ha (a group of activists who admired the Emperor and hated foreigners, advocating the need for expelling them from Japan), became a Kokuji goyogakari (a general official of the Imperial Household in charge of the State affair) in 1862, and a Giso (Noble Council) in the next year.

He took an active part as a court noble of the Sonno-joi-ha (a group of activists who admired the Emperor and hated foreigners, advocating the need for expelling them from Japan), became Kokuji goyogakari (a general official of the Imperial Household in charge of the State affair) in 1862, and Giso (a Noble Council) in the next year.
sen.cmt: 冠詞削除、冠詞の位置変更しました。
sen.e: He took an active part as a court noble of the Sonno-joi-ha (a group of activists who admired the Emperor and hated foreigners, advocating the need for expelling them from Japan), became Kokuji goyogakari (a general official of the Imperial Household in charge of the State affair) in 1862, and Giso (a Noble Council) in the next year.

sen.j: しかし、1863年（文久3年）に起こった八月十八日の政変に関与し謹慎となった。
sen.e: However, since his taking part in Coup of August 18 that had occurred in 1863, he became penitent.
However, since he took part in Coup of August 18 that occurred in 1863, he was suspended.
sen.cmt: 「謹慎」の表現変更、his taking変更しました。
sen.e: However, since he took part in Coup of August 18 that occurred in 1863, he was suspended.

sen.j: 王政復古の後、1868年（慶応4年）1月に明治政府の参与・議定として内国事務総督を兼ね、2月には内国事務局督。
sen.e: After the Restoration of Imperial Rule, in January, 1868, he joined and constituted the Meiji government by working concurrently as the Ministerial Governor of Internal Affairs, and became the Internal Affairs Secretariat in February.

After the Restoration of Imperial Rule, in January, 1868, he joined the Meiji government by working as sanyo (Councilor), gijo (regislator) and the Ministerial Governor of Internal Affairs concurrently, and became the captain of the Internal Affairs Secretariat in February.
sen.cmt: 「参与・議定として」「督」が訳抜けのため補完しました。
sen.e: After the Restoration of Imperial Rule, in January, 1868, he joined the Meiji government by working as sanyo (Councilor), gijo (regislator) and the Ministerial Governor of Internal Affairs concurrently, and became the captain of the Internal Affairs Secretariat in February.

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）内廷職知事、ついで大納言に至った。
sen.e: In 1869, he became the governor for the Imperial family and finally got promoted to the chief councilor of state.
In 1869, he became the governor of the inner Court and finally got promoted to the chief councilor of state.
In 1869, he became the governor of the inner Court and finally got promoted to the chief councilor of state.

sen.j: 1871年宮内省に入り、侍従長・宮内卿と兼任に至った。
sen.e: In 1871, he entered Imperial Household Ministry, worked concurrently as the grand chamberlain, and Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household).
In 1871, he entered Imperial Household Ministry, worked concurrently as the grand chamberlain and Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household).
In 1871, he entered Imperial Household Ministry, worked concurrently as the grand chamberlain and Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household).

sen.j: 1884年（明治17年）、華族令により侯爵に列せられる。
sen.e: In 1884, in accordance with the Peerage Law, he was listed among the Marquises.
In 1884, in accordance with the Peerage Law, he was listed among the Marquises.
In 1884, in accordance with the Peerage Law, he was listed among the Marquises.

sen.j: 1906年、大勲位菊花大綬章を受章した。
sen.e: In 1906, he was awarded the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
In 1906, he was awarded the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
In 1906, he was awarded the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.

sen.j: 1911年4月、多年の勲功により公爵に陞爵した。
sen.e: In April, 1911, he was promoted to the duke in view of his many years of distinguished services and achievements.
In April, 1911, he was promoted to the prince in view of his many years of distinguished services and achievements.
In April, 1911, he was promoted to the prince in view of his many years of distinguished services and achievements.

sen.j: 1891年内大臣兼侍従長となり、明治天皇の側近として天皇が崩御するまで補佐した。
sen.e: In 1891, he became concurrently the Chancellor Minister and the Grand Chamberlain, serving beside the Emperor Mutsuhito until the Emperor passed away.
In 1891, he became Minister of the Interior and the grand chamberlain concurrently, serving beside Emperor Meiji until the Emperor passed away.
sen.cmt: 語順変更、「明治天皇」変更、用語統一のため小文字化、「内大臣」用語統一しました。
sen.e: In 1891, he became Minister of the Interior and the grand chamberlain concurrently, serving beside Emperor Meiji until the Emperor passed away.

sen.j: 明治天皇の政治関与には強く反対し、元田永孚らが侍補制度を定めて天皇親政運動を行った折にはその阻止に動いた。
sen.e: Strongly opposing the political participation of Emperor Mutsuhito, he activated the obstruction when Nagazane MOTODA established the samurai assistant system to launch the Movement of Direct Rule by the Emperor.
Strongly opposing the political participation of Emperor Meiji, when Nagazane MOTODA established the Emperor assistant system to launch the Movement of Direct Rule by the Emperor he obstructed it.
sen.cmt: 「明治天皇」変更、「侍補制度」訂正、文の簡略化、語順変更しました。
sen.e: Strongly opposing the political participation of Emperor Meiji, when Nagazane MOTODA established the Emperor assistant system to launch the Movement of Direct Rule by the Emperor he obstructed it.

sen.j: また、自らの政治的関与も強く戒めて侍従長在任中は政界に転じた実弟の西園寺公望とは公の場所以外では会話しなかったと言われている。
sen.e: Moreover, it is said that he was himself so strongly warned against political participation that, while he was serving as the Grand Chamberlain, he refrained himself from talking in nonpublic occasions with his real younger brother Kinmochi SAIONJI, who became working in the political world.

Moreover, it is said that he strongly warned himself against political participation, so while he was serving as the Grand Chamberlain, he refrained himself from talking in nonpublic occasions with his real younger brother Kinmochi SAIONJI, who became working in the political world.

Moreover, it is said that he strongly warned himself against political participation, so while he was serving as the Grand Chamberlain, he refrained himself from talking in nonpublic occasions with his real younger brother Kinmochi SAIONJI, who became working in the political world.

sen.j: 1919年（大正8年）6月4日、逝去。
sen.e: He passed away on June 4, 1919.
He passed away on June 4, 1919.
He passed away on June 4, 1919.

sen.j: 家系図
sen.e: Genealogy
Genealogy
Genealogy

sen.j: 東山天皇―閑院宮直仁親王―輔平－政煕―政通―公純―実則
sen.e: Emperor Higashiyama-Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Naohito-Sukehira －Masahiro -Masamichi -Kinito -Sanetsune
Emperor Higashiyama-Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Naohito-Sukehira－Masahiro-Masamichi-Kinito-Sanetsune
sen.cmt: 形式を統一のため余分なスペース削除しました。
sen.e: Emperor Higashiyama-Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Naohito-Sukehira－Masahiro-Masamichi-Kinito-Sanetsune

sen.j: 官職位階履歴
sen.e: Government post rank history
Career of job grade
Career of job grade

sen.j: ※日付は明治5年まで旧暦
sen.e: *The dates are listed according to the old calendar until 1872.
*The dates until 1872 are listed according to the old calendar.
*Date according to old lunar calendar until 1872
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 1848年(嘉永元)7月12日、従五位下に叙位。
sen.e: On July 12, 1848, he was appointed Junior Fifth Lower Court Rank.
On July 12, 1848, he was appointed Junior Fifth Lower Court Rank.
On July 12, 1848, he was appointed Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: Junior Fifth Lower Court Rank →Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)

sen.j: 1849年(嘉永2)1月5日、従五位上に昇叙。
sen.e: On January 5, 1849, he was promoted to Junior Fifth Upper Court Rank.
On January 5, 1849, he was promoted to Junior Fifth Upper Court Rank.
On January 5, 1849, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: Junior Fifth Upper Court Rank→Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade)

sen.j: 1850年(嘉永3)2月3日、正五位下に昇叙。
sen.e: On February 3, 1850, he was promoted to Senior Fifth Lower Court Rank.
On February 3, 1850, Senior Fifth Lower Court Rank.
sen.cmt: 前列との繰り返し部分削除しました。
sen.e: On February 3, 1850, Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: Senior Fifth Lower Court Rank→Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)

sen.j: 1851年(嘉永4)3月22日、侍従に任官。
sen.e: On March 22, 1851, he was appointed Chamberlain.
On March 22, 1851, he was appointed Chamberlain.
On March 22, 1851, he was appointed Chamberlain.

sen.j: 7月28日、従四位下に昇叙し、侍従如元。
sen.e: On July 28, he was promoted to Junior Fourth Lower Court Rank, and remained in the position of chamberlain.
On July 28, he was promoted to Junior Fourth Lower Court Rank, and remained in the position of the Chamberlain.
sen.cmt: 冠詞挿入、前列との統一のため大文字化しました。
sen.e: On July 28, he was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), and remained in the position of the Chamberlain.
sen.cmt: unior Fourth Lower Court Rank→Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)

sen.j: 12月4日、元服し、禁色と昇殿を聴される。
sen.e: On December 4, he celebrated his attainment of manhood, was promoted to Kinjiki and was admitted to the court.

On December 4, he celebrated his attainment of manhood and was admitted kinjiki (literally, "forbidden colours," seven colours tradionally reserved for the imperial family and nobility) and to access to the imperial court.
sen.cmt: 「金色」は役職ではないので訂正しました。
sen.e: On December 4, he celebrated his attainment of manhood and was admitted kinjiki (literally, "forbidden colours," seven colours tradionally reserved for the imperial family and nobility) and to access to the imperial court.

sen.j: 1852年(嘉永5)1月27日、従四位上に昇叙し、侍従如元。
sen.e: On January 27, 1852, he was promoted to Junior Fourth Upper Court Rank, and kept his position of chamberlain.
On January 27, 1852, he was promoted to Junior Fourth Upper Court Rank, and kept his position of the Chamberlain.
sen.cmt: 冠詞挿入、前列との統一のため大文字化しました。
sen.e: On January 27, 1852, he was promoted to Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), and kept his position of the Chamberlain.
sen.cmt: Junior Fourth Upper Court Rank→Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade)

sen.j: 1853年(嘉永6)5月8日、正四位下に昇叙し、侍従如元。
sen.e: On May 8, 1853, he was promoted to Senior Fourth Lower Court Rank, and kept his position of chamberlain.
On May 8, 1853, Senior Fourth Lower Court Rank, and kept his position.
sen.cmt: 前列との繰り返し部分削除しました。
sen.e: On May 8, 1853, Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), and kept his position.
sen.cmt: Senior Fourth Lower Court Rank→Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)

sen.j: 1854年(嘉永7)3月7日、近衛府に転任。
sen.e: On March 7, 1854, he was transferred to Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
On March 7, 1854, he was transferred to Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
On March 7, 1854, he was transferred to Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 1857年(安政4)12月8日、近衛府に転任。
sen.e: On December 8, 1857, he was transferred to Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
On December 8, 1857, he was transferred to Konoefu.
sen.cmt: 「近衛府」の説明削除。前列と役職名が同じで「転任」とはおかしいのですが、原文に従いそのままとしました。ちなみにウェブ上では「左近衛権中将に転任」となっていました。
sen.e: On December 8, 1857, he was transferred to Konoefu.

sen.j: 12月19日、従三位に昇叙し、近衛府如元。
sen.e: On December 19, he was promoted to Junior Third Court Rank, and kept his position of Konoefu.
On December 19, he was promoted to Junior Third Court Rank, and kept his position in the Konoefu.
sen.cmt: 前置詞変更、冠詞挿入しました。
sen.e: On December 19, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), and kept his position in the Konoefu.
sen.cmt: Junior Third Court Rank→Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank)

sen.j: 1858年(安政5)3月24日、正三位に昇叙し、左近衛権中将如元。
sen.e: On March 24, 1858, he was promoted to Senior Third Lower Court Rank, and kept his position of Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards.
On March 24, 1858, he was promoted to Senior Third Lower Court Rank, and kept his position of Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards.
On March 24, 1858, he was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), and kept his position of Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards.
sen.cmt: Senior Third Lower Court Rank→Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank)

sen.j: 1862年(文久2)4月25日、中納言に転任。
sen.e: On April 25, 1862, he was transferred to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
On April 25, 1862, he was transferred to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
On April 25, 1862, he was transferred to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: 12月9日、朝廷の国事御用掛を兼帯。
sen.e: On December 9, he was transferred to Kokuji goyogakari (a general official of the Imperial Household in charge of the State affairs) in the Court.
On December 9, he was additionally assigned Kokuji goyogakari (a general official of the Imperial Household in charge of the State affairs) in the Court.
sen.cmt: 「転任」をしたのではなく「兼帯」なので、訂正しました。
sen.e: On December 9, he was additionally assigned Kokuji goyogakari (a general official of the Imperial Household in charge of the State affairs) in the Court.

sen.j: 12月24日、従二位に昇叙し、中納言・国事御用掛如元。
sen.e: On December 24, he was promoted to Junior Second Court Rank, and concurrently served as the Chunagon and the Kokuji goyogakari.
On December 24, he was promoted to Junior Second Court Rank, and concurrently served as the Chunagon and the Kokuji goyogakari.
On December 24, he was promoted to Junii (Junior Second Rank), and concurrently served as the Chunagon and the Kokuji goyogakari.
sen.cmt: Junior Second Court Rank→Junii (Junior Second Rank)統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 1863年(文久3)4月17日、議奏を兼帯。
sen.e: On April 17, 1863, he served also as a giso (a position conveying what the congress decides to the emperor).
On April 17, 1863, he served also as giso (a position conveying what the congress decides to the emperor).
On April 17, 1863, he served also as giso (a position conveying what the congress decides to the emperor).

sen.j: 8月24日、議奏を辞す。
sen.e: On August 24, he quit the position of giso.
On August 24, he quit the position of giso.
On August 24, he quit the position of giso.

sen.j: 1867年(慶応3)2月28日、正二位に昇叙し、権中納言・国事御用掛如元。
sen.e: On February 28, 1867, he was promoted to Senior Second Court Rank, and kept his positions of the Chunagon and the Kokuji goyogakari.
On February 28, 1867, he was promoted to Senior Second Court Rank, and kept his positions of the Chunagon and the Kokuji goyogakari.
On February 28, 1867, he was promoted to Shonii (Senior Second Rank), and kept his positions of Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) and the Kokuji goyogakari.
sen.cmt: Senior Second Court Rank→ Shonii (Senior Second Rank)the Chunagon→Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state)統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 12月9日、国事御用掛廃止により、その補任を解く。
sen.e: On December 9, with the abolition of the Kokuji goyogakari, his appointment was released.
On December 9, with the abolition of the Kokuji goyogakari, he was released from the position.
sen.cmt: 「補任を解く」の表現変更しました。
sen.e: On December 9, with the abolition of the Kokuji goyogakari, he was released from the position.

sen.j: 1868年(慶応4)1月3日、明治政府参与を兼帯。
sen.e: On January 3, 1868, he participated in the Meiji government.
On January 3, 1868, he was additionally assigned sanyo in the Meiji government.
sen.cmt: 「参与」が抜けているので補いました（既出のため説明省略）
sen.e: On January 3, 1868, he was additionally assigned sanyo in the Meiji government.

sen.j: 1月9日、政府の参与から議定に異動。
sen.e: On January 9, he moved from the government participation to Gijo (making agreements).
On January 9, he moved from the sanyo to gijo in the government.
sen.cmt: 「参与」が抜けているので補いました（既出のため説明省略）。小文字化しました。
sen.e: On January 9, he moved from the sanyo to gijo in the government.

sen.j: 2月2日、大納言に転任。
sen.e: On February 2, he was transferred to the chief councilor of state.
On February 2, he was transferred to the chief councilor of state.
On February 2, he was transferred to the chief councilor of state.

sen.j: 議定如元。
sen.e: He kept his position of Gijo.
He kept his position of the gijo.
sen.cmt: 小文字化、冠詞挿入しました。
sen.e: He kept his position of the gijo.

sen.j: 1月20日、政府内国事務局督を兼帯。
sen.e: On January 20, he was concurrently appointed the Internal Affairs Secretariat.
On January 20, he was concurrently appointed the captain of the Internal Affairs Secretariat.
sen.cmt: 「督」が訳抜けのため補完しました。
sen.e: On January 20, he was concurrently appointed the captain of the Internal Affairs Secretariat.

sen.j: 閏4月21日、政府官制改正により、議政官たる上局の議定を兼帯。
sen.e: On April 21, because of the revision of the government organization, he was concurrently appointed Gijo of the Jokyoku (supreme bureau) of Giseikan (Legislature).
On April 21, because of the rearrangement of the government organization, he was concurrently appointed the gijo of Jokyoku (supreme bureau) in Giseikan (Legislature).
sen.cmt: 小文字化、冠詞削除＆挿入、前置詞変更、revision変更しました。
sen.e: On April 21, because of the rearrangement of the government organization, he was concurrently appointed the gijo of Jokyoku (supreme bureau) in Giseikan (Legislature).

sen.j: 内国事務局督如元。
sen.e: He kept his position of Internal Affairs Secretariat.
He kept his position of the captain of the Internal Affairs Secretariat.
sen.cmt: 「督」が訳抜けのため補完しました。
sen.e: He kept his position of the captain of the Internal Affairs Secretariat.

sen.j: 1869年(明治2)7月8日、官制改正により、大納言に任官。
sen.e: On July 8, 1869, because of the revision of the government organization, he was appointed the chief councilor of state.
On July 8, 1869, because of the rearrangement of the government organization, he was appointed the chief councilor of state.
On July 8, 1869, because of the rearrangement of the government organization, he was appointed the chief councilor of state.

sen.j: 4月、内廷職知事兼帯。
sen.e: In April, he was concurrently appointed the governor for the Imperial family.
In April, he was concurrently appointed the governor of the inner Court.
In April, he was concurrently appointed the governor of the inner Court.

sen.j: 1870年(明治3)2月、山口宣撫使を兼帯。
sen.e: In February, 1870, he was also appointed the inspector of Yamaguchi pacification.
In February, 1870, he was also appointed the position of Yamaguchi pacification.
sen.cmt: 宣撫使はinspectorではないようなので変更しました。
sen.e: In February, 1870, he was also appointed the position of Yamaguchi pacification.

sen.j: 1871年(明治4)7月14日、大納言を辞し、麝香間祗候となる。
sen.e: On July 14, 1871, he quit the position of chief councilor of state, and became Jako no ma shiko (emperor's personal attendant in Jako room).
On July 14, 1871, he quit the position of the chief councilor of state, and became Jako no ma shiko (emperor's personal attendant in Jako room).
On July 14, 1871, he quit the position of the chief councilor of state, and became Jako no ma shiko (emperor's personal attendant in Jako room).

sen.j: 8月4日、侍従長に任官。
sen.e: On August 4, he was appointed Grand chamberlain.
On August 4, he was appointed grand chamberlain.
sen.cmt: 用語統一のため小文字化しました。
sen.e: On August 4, he was appointed grand chamberlain.

sen.j: 9月15日、宮内卿を兼任。
sen.e: On September 15, he was also appointed Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household).
On September 15, he was also appointed Kunaikyo.
sen.cmt: 宮内卿の説明は既出のため削除しました。
sen.e: On September 15, he was also appointed Kunaikyo.

sen.j: 1877年(明治10)8月29日、侍従長の廃止に伴い、一等侍補を兼帯。
sen.e: On August 29, 1877, with the abolition of the Grand chamberlain, he was also appointed First Rank Samurai Assistant.
On August 29, 1877, with the abolition of the grand chamberlain, he was also appointed First Rank Assistant to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 用語統一のため小文字化、「侍補」の意味訂正しました。
sen.e: On August 29, 1877, with the abolition of the grand chamberlain, he was also appointed First Rank Assistant to the Emperor.

sen.j: 11月22日、勲一等旭日大綬章を受勲受章。
sen.e: On November 22, he was awarded the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun.
On November 22, he was awarded the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun.
On November 22, he was awarded the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun.

sen.j: 1884年(明治17)3月21日、宮内卿を辞し、侍従長の職制復活により侍従長となる。
sen.e: On March 21, 1884, he quit the position of Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household) and became Grand chamberlain with the revival of the organizational system of Grand chamberlain.
On March 21, 1884, he quit the position of the Kunaikyo and became the grand chamberlain with the revival of the post.
sen.cmt: 宮内卿の説明は既出のため削除、冠詞挿入、用語統一のため小文字化、文の簡略化しました。
sen.e: On March 21, 1884, he quit the position of the Kunaikyo and became the grand chamberlain with the revival of the post.

sen.j: 7月7日、侯爵を受爵。
sen.e: On July 7, he was awarded as a marquis.
On July 7, he was granted the rank of marquis.
sen.cmt: 動詞変更、rank of挿入しました。
sen.e: On July 7, he was granted the rank of marquis.

sen.j: 1885年(明治18)7月、華族局長官を兼帯。
sen.e: In July, 1885, he was appointed the official of the Peerage Bureau.
In July, 1885, he was appointed the director of the Peerage Bureau.
In July, 1885, he was appointed the director of the Peerage Bureau.

sen.j: 1891年(明治24)2月21日、内大臣に異動し、侍従長如元。
sen.e: On February 21, 1891, he was transferred as the Chancellor Minister, and kept the position of Grand chamberlain.
On February 21, 1891, he was transferred to the Minister of the Interior, and kept the position of the grand chamberlain.
sen.cmt: 「内大臣」用語統一、小文字化しました。
sen.e: On February 21, 1891, he was transferred to the Minister of the Interior, and kept the position of the grand chamberlain.

sen.j: 1895年(明治28)10月7日、勲一等旭日桐花大綬章を受章。
sen.e: On October 7, 1895, he was awarded Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower.
On October 7, 1895, he was awarded Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower.
On October 7, 1895, he was awarded Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower.

sen.j: 1899年(明治32)12月、従一位に昇叙。
sen.e: In December, 1899, he was promoted to Junior First Court Rank.
In December, 1899, he was promoted to Junior First Court Rank.
In December, 1899, he was promoted to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
sen.cmt: Junior First Court Rank→Juichii (Junior First Rank)

sen.j: 1906年(明治39)4月1日、大勲位菊花大綬章を受勲受章。
sen.e: On April 1, 1906, he was awarded Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
On April 1, 1906, he was awarded Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
On April 1, 1906, he was awarded Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.

sen.j: 1911年(明治44)4月21日、公爵を受爵。
sen.e: On April 21, 1911, he was awarded as a Duke.
On April 21, 1911, he was granted the rank of Prince.
sen.cmt: 動詞変更、rank of挿入しました。
sen.e: On April 21, 1911, he was granted the rank of Prince.

sen.j: 1912年(大正元)8月13日、内大臣・侍従長を辞す。
sen.e: On August 13, 1912, he quit the positions of Chancellor Minister and Grand chamberlain.
On August 13, 1912, he quit the positions of the Minister of the Interior and the grand chamberlain.
sen.cmt: 「内大臣」用語統一、小文字化、冠詞挿入しました。
sen.e: On August 13, 1912, he quit the positions of the Minister of the Interior and the grand chamberlain.

sen.j: 1919年(大正8)6月4日、大勲位菊花章頸飾を受章
sen.e: On June 4, 1919, he was awarded Collar of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
On June 4, 1919, he was awarded Collar of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
On June 4, 1919, he was awarded Collar of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
